page.title: 10PENCERRIG PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built about 120 years ago by Mrs.Clara Thomas for the children of Pencerrig estate workers and tenants. When the 2 railway lines wre built it was enlarged to accommodate the railway families living at the new village at this important railway junction at Builth Road. Since the closure of one line and the decline of the other, there are no railway workers now. The population has declined to such an extent that this school is to be closed in July 1986 and our remaining children transferred to Llanelwedd or Newbridge schools,(where rolls are also falling). We are told that a great deal of money will be saved by closing this school, but it is very sad that it is considered an economic necessity to close these small rural schools which have taught so well.
